Key Arguments: The legislation threatens free speech by potentially shutting down lawful discussions on social issues.
The bill uses vague and subjective definitions of harm, which could be weaponized to prevent legitimate debate.
The legislation could lead to excessive censorship by private companies due to the threat of massive fines.
Historical examples show that unpopular ideas can later be proven true, suggesting that centralized control over information is dangerous.
The bill lacks sufficient safeguards against misuse of censorship powers and creates double standards by excluding government-authorized content.
Notable Quotes: The necessity of this legislation is certainly questionable when speech crimes such as defamation and inciting violence are already outlawed.
The definitions contained in the draft bill are also outrageously vague and subjective.
This bill tramples on freedom of speech by compelling big tech to silence discussion.
A healthy, functioning democracy requires freedom of speech, which means that ideas from across the ideological and political spectrum can be discussed and debated by anyone.
